criterion: Reward for faithfully documenting the patient’s report of feeling largely the same, with only possible slight increase in energy, following the increase to 88 mcg levothyroxine, as well as the clinician’s inquiry about new or unusual symptoms.

Reward for accurately capturing medication regimen details and instructions: levothyroxine 88 mcg taken on an empty stomach each morning, atorvastatin 20 mg taken at night, and the advice to watch for palpitations or increased sweating.

Reward for appropriately leveraging chart information that is directly relevant to the encounter—patient’s age/sex, active problems (hypothyroidism, hyperlipidemia), and current medications—without importing unrelated chart content.

Penalize for omission of any major fact, instruction, or patient statement present in the transcript (e.g., absence of new symptoms, medication-spacing confirmation, specific side-effect warnings), resulting in an incomplete note.
Penalize for inclusion of information not present or inferable from either the transcript or the chart (e.g., new labs, follow-up plans, vitals, diagnoses) that constitutes fabrication.
Penalize for any inaccuracy or distortion of concrete details from transcript or chart, such as wrong medication name, dose, timing, or misrepresentation of what the patient or clinician said.

Penalize for indiscriminate or excessive copying of chart data that was not referenced in the visit (e.g., unrelated family history, empty template sections), reducing fidelity and adding irrelevant content.
